intro: Alsine yungasensis, commonly known as the Yungas alsine, is a flowering plant native to the Yungas region of Bolivia and northern Argentina. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests at high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and pink or white. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
